page.title: 11 WYCHDON LODGE.
page.content: Wychdon Lodge was built in 1842, the early victorian era, by William Moore, a banker who also built the nearby Saltworks. The lodge is situated close to a small village, called Shirleywich, near the A51. The site consists of seven bedrooms, two bathrooms, five downstair rooms, and a cellar.The remaining servant quarters were demolished apart from the Butler's pantry which is now used as a kitchen. In 1939, during the first World War, soldiers stayed at Wychdon Lodge for a short period of time, in which valuables were damaged particulary at the old Grange. This can still be seen today. Wychdon Lodge was once a major part ofthe local history but in recent years has decreased in importance.
